data.prayer: Lord, there are 5,705 people in the state of Saint Patrick who claim Christianity, but may have never read the Bible. Please challenge them today to read the Bible for themselves.
data.verse: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Saint Patrick, Dominica
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Father, move the 1,386 believers in the state of Saint Patrick to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

data.prayer: Over 7.91 percent of the people of Saint Patrick are far from Jesus.
Father, convict the 1,386 believers in Saint Patrick to be holy and righteous. Inspire them to gather in small groups for accountability and spiritual growth.

data.focus_label: Pray for the city of Berekua
data.prayer: Pray that God raises up new churches in the city of Berekua, Saint Patrick, Dominica.
God, we pray for the believers in Saint Patrick, Dominica to be generous so that they would be worthy of greater investment by you.
Jesus, like with the centurion who came to you for his sick servant, please call into your house those who have great faith but are not yet yours in the state of Saint Patrick
data.verse: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turning to the crowd that followed him, said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith.” And when those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the servant well.

data.section_summary:
the state of Saint Patrick, Dominica has a population of 7,700.

We estimate Saint Patrick has 1,386 people who might know Jesus, 5,705 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 609 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 5 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, please make every disciple be a disciple maker, every home a training center, and every church a church planting movement in the state of Saint Patrick.
